segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s standing in a puddle, and it’s spreading fast, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are sneaking cookies behind her back, and she’s totally oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to fall off that wobbly stool any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her share, like this is a normal thing to do.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything looks outside the window while chaos is brewing inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and she’s still polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll notice before the whole kitchen is flooded.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, he’s practically hanging off the cabinet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I’m just watching like this is some kind of show.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so absurd, I don’t know whether to laugh or panic.
segments.speaker: PAR
